parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To admonish, warn, counsel, exhort. From the same as nouthesia; to put in mind, i.e. to caution or reprove gently.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
